snippet: Bill O’Toole works as the seventh prognosticator of J. Gruber’s Hagerstown Town and Country Almanack, a line of work that began in 1797 with a star-savvy blacksmith.
abstract: Dan Barry This Land column on Bill O'Toole of Emmitsburg, Md, who, for more than forty years, has served as prognosticator of J Gruber's Hagerstown Town and Country Almanack; O'Toole makes predictive weather maps for 217-year-old almanac, slim volume available to farmers, merchants and all other citizens, up to 18 months in advance.
lead_paragraph: Bill O’Toole works as the seventh prognosticator of J. Gruber’s Hagerstown Town and Country Almanack, a line of work that began in 1797 with a star-savvy blacksmith.

headline.print_headline: Divining the Weather, With Methods Old and New
headline.seo: For 40 Years, Predicting Weather for Gruber’s Almanack
headline.main: Divining the Weather, With Methods Old and New
